website_summaries.verdict: Autoduplexing, multiple input options, and acceptable photo and text quality make this printer a versatile choice for home and small-office users who aren't in a hurry.

customer_reviews.title: need old operating system to use
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for ten years. Light use, but no problems at all except I never could get it to print a B&W text with only the black ink. Even when set on draft mode...I am sure it was using color as the color cartridges always ran out all at one time. Most of my printing was B&W text. I still like the printer. It does really nice photos. However, it does not work with newer Mac operating systems. They quit upgrading drivers. With a down-loaded third party driver, I can do some text.
customer_reviews.author: moderate user

customer_reviews.title: It's good, but not great...
customer_reviews.text: As a graphic designer I like this printer, but even I have problems getting the settings/preferences "right". Half the time you don't know what the heck you're gonna get. My main grief with this printer besides the settings, is how dark it prints stuff. The colors typically come out fine, but I've wasted a lot of paper trying to get the tones right. Pros: Separate ink cartridges(& reasonably priced replacements). Prints full bleeds. Reasonably priced. Lots of settings/preferences. Cons: Prints dark. Large/bulky. Doesn't include printer cable. Lots of settings/preferences.
customer_reviews.author: Joanofarc

customer_reviews.title: A color Printer that put in it's hours of use
customer_reviews.text: Color ink jet printer. Can print photos when the "Photo Paper" is loaded in the printer's paper cassette.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Ball

customer_reviews.title: SAVE MONEY ON INK BY USING A LASER PRINTER FOR BLACK AND WHITE
customer_reviews.text: Here's a tip for saving money on ink. This is a great printer - true. I love the duplex feature, but it uses a lot of ink. However, you're wasting your money using an ink jet for black and white printing. Instead, purchase a cheap laser printer. You'll print 1,500 pages before needing another cartridge. I save my PIXMA for photos only and use my Brother laser jet (purchased for under $100) for everything else.
customer_reviews.author: A customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE!
customer_reviews.text: FOR $62.00 SHIPPED TO MY HOME I COULDN'T BE HAPPIER AT THIS TIME. THIS IS A CAPABLE PRINTER FOR MY GENERAL HOME COMPUTER USES. I LIKE THE AUTO SHEET FEEDER OR CASSETTE PAPER OPTIONS. IT PRINTS OUT TEXT VERY FAST AND FULL PAGE PICTURES COME OUT PRETTY FAST TOO. I'M PRETTY SURE THIS PRINTER IS AT THE END OF ITS' RUN AND THERE ARE NEWER MODELS OUT THERE SO YOU CAN PROBABLY GET A SWEET DEAL ON ANY REMAINING. IF I GET SOME LONGEVITY OUT OF THIS PRINTER THEN I WILL CONSIDER IT AN EXCELLENT PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: BRITTGYPSY

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful little printer.
customer_reviews.text: Disregard comments from reviewers who say you can't buy ink refill kits or individual ink cartridges for this printer - you can. So far, this is the best printer I have ever owned. And I have owned several HPs and two Canon S750s. It prints text, graphics, and photos, and it prints them well. There are many good reasons why Consumer Reports ranked this the no. 1 inkjet printer. Try it. You'll like it.
customer_reviews.author: uncle-buck

customer_reviews.title: Hoot Owl in Misssouri
customer_reviews.text: Although I have been extremely pleased with past Cannon printers, I have had difficulty with the paper feed of this unit from the beginning of use. The paper consistently does not pass through the printer, in either the cassette or auto feed from above. When the paper feed does work, I am pleased with its performance in both text and photo printing. I have contacted cumtomer service at Canon via e-mail. I was given the option to take the printer to an authorized repair center or to mail it back to Canon for a replacement. I have chosen to replace the unit. So the situation at present is unresolved. I will update this review, reporting the eventual outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Alan R. Soddy

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful printer. I bought it to print edible images (with special ink of course) and it really exceded my expectations. The images come out very sharp and very clear. They really have a photograph quality. I'd recommend it to every one looking for a Photo printer. The down side might be the price of the ink cartridges. But as I said before I use it with specialty cartridges so I can't really comment about it.
customer_reviews.author: Soledad Aldana

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma iP4200
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this printer for a month now. So far it is working great. Haven't had any problems at all. If you are looking for an affordable, realiable inkjet printer that can produce good quality photo printing, this is the printer for you. Only downside to this printer is their ink cartridges. Each ink cartridge have a computer chip that it will not allow refilling of the tank or use of any non-Canon brand ink cartridge. Overall a great printer, but if you do not feel like buying only Canon brand ink cartridges, you might want to look into higher end Canon printer that does not require the same ink cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Best in the league of inkjets at the time
customer_reviews.text: Practically bulletproof. Versatile for everything from index cards to Glossy photos. Quiet=even when not in quiet mode setting. Very resourceful with ink. For my PC I can go for months on one cartridge color. Feeds evenly and the duplex is worth every penny to save paper and allow for additional page type options.
customer_reviews.author: Soundlubber

customer_reviews.title: Great desktop printer.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous color photo printer at a great price. I have one at home and one at work and I couldn't be happier. I used to buy only Epson photo printers, but their quality seems to have declined in recent years. After a brief warmup, this printer is fast! And the color quality is excellent. The multiple ink cartridges can be a bit of a pain (2 separate black cartridges!), but it's worth it when you see the printed result. This printer even does a good job with the cheaper photo papers.
customer_reviews.author: Just4Me

customer_reviews.title: Great value and performance
customer_reviews.text: We don't have alot of need for a printer but when we do we enjoy good performance. This unit peforms flawlessly and makes great photos which is one of my favorite things to do with the printer. It is early in the game but so far very pleased. I have a hard time giving anything 5 stars but this is one time I feel confident that for the money spent I couldn't have done better. Have had in my home for over a year now and everything I said above still applies. Uses ink but they all do. It is July 4th 2007 and still running like a champ
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H. Pickard

customer_reviews.title: Printer
customer_reviews.text: Kinda silly to write a critique on a printer that is already obsolete. But, i did buy it because i bought the same printer 10 years ago and was very happy with it. I was very lucky to be able to find a brand new one still available for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: Best printer on the Mkt.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Canon IP 4200 pixma printer, my first printer worked hard for 4 years without a problem. As before I am more than satisfied with this printer. Great photos each and every time. The easy photo print program that comes with the printer is great and makes all of my printing jobs fun and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Gaudium

customer_reviews.title: NEVER WORKED!
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these once and it was great. This one, however, never worked. Canon won't return my calls and emails. BIG waste of money. Beware of anything labeled "refurbished."
customer_reviews.author: Heitzer

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This my first printer upgrade in many years and I must say I am impressed. I could not believe how fast it prints compared to my HP 870c SE, which granted is a much older printer. Set up is a breeze, printed photos and other images are awesome. Text quality is also very good. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Greg29

customer_reviews.title: my kind of printer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit used, since my original one finally quit. I couldn't find a new one for a reasonable price. I get super pictures printed off it as well as printing. I can get the ink cartriges refilled, and do the black one myself. It is user friendly, which is more than I can say for the six others I've had. The person I bought this used one from, packed it really well and put in some extra ink cartridges. I had some apprehension about buying a used one, but was pleasantly surprised. Hooray for me!!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie J. Mclenithan

customer_reviews.title: My third Pixma in the family.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Pixma 4000 and loved it, so I got my oldest daughter a Pixma 4000 and she loves it. Then I got my youngest daughter a Pixma 4200 and she loves it. The only drawback for me is that the ink cartridges are not the same for the two models. Probably not a problem for most people.
customer_reviews.author: CATHY Eckers

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This printer has the best quality of any printer I have used. I can't tell yet how the ink holds up, but if it does close to what my Epson or HP printers did, it will be a good investment all around. I would buy again from Amazon and a Cannon printer also.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Still working after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter's room 3 years ago. Just needed a good basic printer and that's what I got. Prints fine. Everything still works. I'm pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hole

customer_reviews.title: Poor photo printing
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Canon products for years. I have bought 5 DSLR cameras (sold 2 after about a year) and found them to be excellent. Now I know that this is an inexpensive consumer color printer but the photo quality is just poor. There is no nice way to put it. The skin tones appear washed out, in fact, all colors appear to be washed out. I'm using Canon paper and I've calibrated my monitor. I guess you get what you pay for but I really expected higher quality from Canon. Color documents are fine.
customer_reviews.author: ZurHoll

customer_reviews.title: I love this older model printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this older model printer. No "all in one"; just a printer I was accustomed to, and I was happy to find one still available.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Canon Printers
customer_reviews.text: I purchase Canon printers for my home and office. Mainly due to operataing costs which are generally very low, compared to most other printers on the market. This printer has the Think Tank System, in which you only replace the ink color which is low. I did print some color photos on high gloss paper, these pictures are better than most any one hour photo can produce, infact I would say they are equal too or better than those produced in the lab. The pictures have great color, true colors and can print fast. It is also a great printer for documents. I would buy this product without hesistation.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert C. Rubin

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC PHOTO PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: This the best photo printer I have ever used. I do a lot of photography work and this printer is beyond great. I have using this printer for at least 12 years and when Canon stopped making them I was frantic. I am so glad that I found it on Amazon and I hope that you will continue to sell this printer providing you still can get the ink
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to repalce an existing and totally worn out unit with the same model. IIt is a work horse for both black and white printing. But the cost of the ink cartridges is high. I use the replacement cartridges with great success.
customer_reviews.author: GVHWOW

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I would rate this as my best printer I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Linda H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Incredible printer. Have had for about 8 months now and no issues. Prints beautiful picutres on 8.5x11, 4x6, or 5x7 sheets. No complaints..very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA iP4200 Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: Printer is a good one. Cartridges are expensive. So far, I haven't found an outfit that will refill them cheaply. Cartridge has a memory chip in it which makes them expensive.
customer_reviews.author: fickjr

customer_reviews.title: Pixma iP4200 printer
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive printer has been great so far. I really like the double-sided printing feature and the two paper feeds. I print quite a few envelopes, so I put them in the tray. Now I just have to remember to switch it back to the upper feed so when someone else uses it, they don't try to print out a spreadsheet on an envelope!!
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Top Grade
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Canon printer. the pictures are outstanding. Too bad the inks are so expensive
customer_reviews.author: Fair Dinkum

customer_reviews.title: satisfied user
customer_reviews.text: printer is well made and does all i expect it to do.my complaint is that their tool bar will only open on internet explorer.
customer_reviews.author: AckerBacker

customer_reviews.title: Canon iP4200 Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer for a kick-about home office printer, not just for photos. My first attempts to test its photo-printing ability were fairly dismal. However, after finding Canon's ICC Profile how-to, results have vastly improved. I paid about $93 out the door for this printer, and I think it's a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Zephyr

customer_reviews.title: A great all around printer
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned a photo printing printer before and I was pleasantly surprised by this order. The pictures I printed (mostly color landscapes and portraits) came out probably 90%-95% as well of how the orginals looked when I bring the pictures into Target to get them printed. I haven't experimented with larger size pictures as all the pictures I printed out were 5"x7", but these small ones seemed fine although a little on the dark which which can be adjusted before printing. Overall, a relatively fast and very quiet photo printer.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Wu

customer_reviews.title: I love this printer
customer_reviews.text: At first I missed my scanner when I bought this printer. However, due to the money I now save on the inexpensive ink cartridges and the quality of the prints, I am a very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but slow
customer_reviews.text: I like this printer - small footprint on my desk, quiet operation, nice print quality. But, it's s l o w. Prints fast enough once the actual printing starts, but it seems to take forever for the thing to start to print. So, if you print lots of individual items throughout the day, you might get a little frustrated with this one. Overall, however, I would recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn G

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought it some time ago and am still using it without no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Angeline Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: The ip4200 has surprisingly fast print speed in both black and color. Photos printed on photo printer could pass for photo shop quality. Simple installation and simple instructions. Can't beat it for the price. Haven't had it long enough to comment on cartridge value.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Realy nice printer
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, great borderless photo, surprisingly quick printing. I like the enclosed paper feed cartridge for plain paper. Time will tell if it will be like my Epson with fatally clogged heads, a problem with ALL ink jets after time. For right now, I am very happy with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Sorry I bought this
customer_reviews.text: The printer itself is quite nice but boy does Canon ever rip you off on the ink! They entice you to buy the printer by offering it at a low price but believe me they will more than make up for it when you are dropping $15-$20 per cartridge for each color. And the ink does not last particularly long, either. Unfortunately, there are no aftermarket cartridges for sale that I know of. If it weren't for the cost of those $% cartridges I would probably give it 5 stars, but as is stands, it is unfortunately a rip-off. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA iP4200 Photo Printer Review
customer_reviews.text: I love the printer. This printer, which is my third Canon in 10 years, replaced my Canon i560. It is faster and the quality of the printing is great. Very satisfied. I opted for the free shipping and the printer still arrived in about 3 days. I am really happy with the entire transaction.
customer_reviews.author: Janet K. Messman

customer_reviews.title: I HATE this printer
customer_reviews.text: It's only a year old, I bought new cartridges and I still have no red ink printing. Cartridges are EXPENSIVE. It "rejected" one of the black cartridges. It tells me the paper isn't loaded correctly (it is, a MORON could load the paper). DO NOT BUY THIS PRINTER
customer_reviews.author: KLPNYCTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma ip4200 Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of the ip4200 printers. The initial reviews were favorable and between the price and rebate I thought it was a good deal. I needed a good all around printer that wasn't initially expensive or costly to replace cartridges. I liked the previous Canon printers I've owned because of the quality and cheaper ink tanks. The price was right and the rebate with the purchase of a Canon digital camera was too good to pass up. I've been happy with the overall print quality, but I haven't used it for photo printing. (...)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Printer was in very good shape. I can not get it to print ...
customer_reviews.text: Printer was in very good shape. I can not get it to print the ink head is corrupt. Would not initiate.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Outman

customer_reviews.title: Quality and speed
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality on plain paper and photo paper. Surprisingly fast. Bought a second one for college bound daughter.
customer_reviews.author: JPMunchkin

customer_reviews.title: avoid
customer_reviews.text: ink is very expensive and there is six differnt ink cart. that needs to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Printer Canon IP4200
customer_reviews.text: I received this unit broken. It doesn't print at all even thought I bougth new cartridges and I used them. I wasted my money and my time with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: M Cervantes

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Canon PIXMA iP4200 is a great printer! Reliable, economic. It can print DVD labels if you reprogram it!
customer_reviews.author: Ruslan Malakhowskiy

customer_reviews.title: PROXIMA Printer
customer_reviews.text: Outstatnding dendability. Printer cartridges are pricy and one must change all of them at once rather than changing just a single one that is low on ink,
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R. Thatcher

customer_reviews.title: The printer didn't work, so I bought a new ...
customer_reviews.text: The printer didn't work,so I bought a new print head and it still did not work. I ended up throwing it in the dump. Never buy a used printeror other used eltronic device.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Fowler

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Printer
customer_reviews.text: Compact size, quiet operation, quality print - both text and photo. We would buy Canon again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma iP4200 is a great deal
customer_reviews.text: I've had several printers over the years and so far this one is the best for the price. Beautiful, clear pictures!
customer_reviews.author: K. George

customer_reviews.title: Best printer for less than $100 ever
customer_reviews.text: This printers is the first one I ever purchased that can produce photo as good or even better than local labs, especially with Canon Paper. I recommend it 100%
customer_reviews.author: V. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Pixima P4200
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality photo prints for under $80. You can't go wrong with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Aragon

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a well designed, just delightful printer. Great pictures and a fine all around printer. Great job, Canon!
customer_reviews.author: Cat-Ketch

customer_reviews.title: Good quality & price
customer_reviews.text: Overall a decent printer at a good price. As mentioned in other reviews, I would have liked a printer cable included.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S

customer_reviews.title: Hard to follow instructions
customer_reviews.text: This is a good printer but after receiving it, the instructions with pictures misled me. It instructed me to remove all taping and I pulled what was the cable and broke it. I then had to call Canon and was directed to a nearby store who got permission to replace the carriage. Clearer photos would be good for the novice.
customer_reviews.author: Thelma Maurer

product_meta.title: Canon PIXMA iP4200 Photo Printer
product_meta.description:
The 9600* x 2400dpi print resolution ensures detailed and vibrant photo lab quality output. Superior quality is achieved by Canon's FINE technology with minute 1pl ink droplets. ContrastPLUS technology with an additional dye based black ink brings extra depth and contrast to photos.

AMAZON.COM
Why bother waiting for the photo lab when you can print images that are just as good--or maybe better--at home? The Canon PIXMA iP4200 combines five-color printing with a 1,856-nozzle print head capable of delivering superfine 1-picoliter ink droplets. The result is gorgeously clean, sharp prints delivered into your hands just minutes after you snapped the shot. 

 Color resolution is as high as 9,600 x 2,400 dpi, with black resolution up to 600 x 600 dpi. Print speeds range up to 29 ppm for monochrome and 19 ppm in color; a borderless 4-by-6-inch photo takes as little as 51 seconds. With the iP4200's automatic two-sided printing, you can easily produce glossy brochures and invitations right from your desktop. Improved ink technology supplies rich black text that offers exceptional resistance to smudges--it even holds up to highlighter pens. (All reported speeds are maximums. Actual speeds will vary.) 

 With its straightforward USB port, connecting the printer with your computer is a snap; the iP4200 is compatible with both Windows and Macintosh operating systems and includes software tools like Easy-PhotoPrint (Windows/Mac), Easy WebPrint (Windows), and PhotoRecord (Windows). A direct print port allows you to print directly from a PictBridge-compatible digital camera or DV camcorder, with or without your computer. The printer is backed with a one-year limited warranty covering parts and labor. 

 What's in the Box
iP4200 photo printer, PGI-5BK black ink tank, CLI-8Bk photo black ink tank, CLI-8C cyan ink tank, CLI-8M magenta ink tank, CLI-8Y yellow ink tank, power cord, setup instructions, CD-ROM, Canon photo paper plus 4" x 6" glossy sample pack, quick start guide, registration and warranty card; printer cable not included

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The PIXMA iP4200 Photo Printer is a high-performance machine, combining exceptional print quality with advanced convenience features. It delivers a resolution of up to 9,600 x 2,400 color dpi,1 for amazing detail and clarity. To achieve this, Canon Full-photolithography Inkjet Nozzle Engineering (FINE) uses a high-performance 1,856-nozzle print head that ejects precise, consistent droplets as small as 1 picoliter, resulting in beautiful photos with virtually no detectable grain.

 Also, the ContrastPLUS 5-color ink system--four dye-based inks and a pigment-based black ink--produces true-life photos with a wide color palette, along with laser-quality text. You'll be amazed at your results.

 High performance doesn't stop there. The PIXMA iP4200 Photo Printer can produce a photo lab quality 4" x 6" borderless print in about 51 seconds.2 (Actual print speeds will vary.) Its USB 2.0 Hi-Speed interface enables the fastest photo transfers possible from your computer.3

 Advanced paper handling and direct photo printing
With a dual paper path, you can keep photo paper stored in one tray and plain paper in another. You're always ready to print--no paper switching required. Plus, you can print two-sided to help save on paper costs. And with direct photo printing, you simply connect any PictBridge compatible digital camera or DV camcorder, and print! This PC-free process saves you time and eliminates the need to be tied to your computer.

 A system for long-lasting photos
The Canon ChromaLife100 system combines the PIXMA iP4200 Photo Printer's FINE print head technology and newly developed inks with select Canon photo papers, with results rivaling that of conventional photos. These beautiful photos will also last up to 100 years when stored in an archival quality photo album.4 And with the new smart LED ink, your LED lamp flashes when ink is running low, and flashes even faster when nearing empty. When you install a new ink tank this smart LED system will even glow to let you know if its not properly installed, making it an ease to use.

 Notes:

 1 Resolution may vary based on printer driver setting. Ink droplets can be placed with a horizontal pitch of 1/4800 inch at minimum.
2 PPM print speeds are based on the highest speed printer driver mode. Photo print speeds are based on the default mode driver setting using Canon Photo Paper Plus Glossy paper. Print speeds will vary depending on system configuration, interface, software, document complexity, print mode, types of paper used and page coverage. Actual speed will vary.
3 USB 2.0 Hi-Speed requires Windows XP, 2000 or Mac OS X operating systems. For Windows 98, Me and Mac OS X v. 10.2 to 10.2.6 operating systems, the printer will operate at USB 1.1 specifications.
4 Based on accelerated testing by Canon in dark storage under controlled temperature, humidity and gas conditions, simulating storage in an album with plastic sleeves. Canon cannot guarantee the longevity of prints; results may vary depending on printed image, drying time, display/storage conditions and environmental factors. 

See more
feature_bullets: Up to 9,600 x 2,400 color dpi resolution, droplets as small as 1 picoliter
Up to 600 x 600 dpi for black text documents; improved smudge resistance
Borderless 4-by-6-inch photos in as little as 51 seconds
Automatic two-sided printing; includes second paper tray

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars173 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
